snippet: Carlos Montoya, who was responsible for certifying that day care centers complied with fire safety standards, is one of six city employees to plead guilty in the scheme so far.
abstract: Carlos Montoya, a longtime New York City Fire Department employee who supervised safety inspections of day care centers, pleads guilty to accepting thousands of dollars in bribes from operators who took part in a program that subsidizes day care costs for low-income parents; Montoya is one of six city employees to plead guilty in what authorities have said was a $1 million scheme involving corrupt city employees and day care operators.
lead_paragraph: Carlos Montoya, who was responsible for certifying that day care centers complied with fire safety standards, is one of six city employees to plead guilty in the scheme so far.
